Interface_name: TCP Server - side by using socket in python
Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a TCP server class in Python that handles client connections, data exchange, and supports various TLS/SSL configurations for secure communication.

Class Description: TLSServerAutomaton is a TCP server implementation that provides secure communication capabilities with configurable TLS parameters. It handles socket creation, binding, client acceptance, data transmission, and cleanup operations.

Attributes:

serversocket: [socket.socket] - The main server socket object
ip_family: [int] - Address family (default: AF_INET)
local_ip: [str] - Local IP address to bind to
local_port: [int] - Local port to bind to
remote_ip: [str] - Connected client's IP address
remote_port: [int] - Connected client's port
client_auth: [bool] - Flag for client authentication requirement
is_echo_server: [bool] - Flag to enable echo server behavior
max_client_idle_time: [int] - Maximum idle time before disconnecting (seconds)
curve: [str] - Preferred elliptic curve for ECDHE
preferred_ciphersuite: [Optional[int]] - Preferred cipher suite
preferred_signature_algorithm: [Union[str, int, None]] - Preferred signature algorithm
cookie: [bool] - Enable DTLS cookie protection
psk_secret: [Optional[str]] - Pre-shared key secret
psk_mode: [Optional[str]] - Pre-shared key mode

Methods:

bind_socket() -> [bool] - Creates and binds the server socket, returns success status
accept_client() -> [None] - Accepts an incoming client connection
close_client_socket() -> [None] - Closes the current client connection
close_server_socket() -> [None] - Closes the server socket
receive_data(timeout: Optional[int] = None) -> [Optional[bytes]] - Receives data from client with optional timeout
send_data(data: bytes) -> [bool] - Sends data to client, returns success status
run_server() -> [None] - Main server loop that handles client connections and data exchange
